“Pyotr Petrovitch,” Dounia said, her voice steady. “This must end today.”

Luzhin frowned. “I can dislike your family, even if I adore you.”

“Don’t take offense,” she replied, her eyes earnest. “I am your betrothed. Trust me.”

“I must choose between you and my brother,” she continued. “If you’re not reconciled, it’s either you or him.”

Luzhin shifted uncomfortably. “This is unacceptable.”

“I need to know who my brother truly is,” she declared. “And if you truly esteem me.” 

Silence hung heavy in the air. Choices loomed large.

**PAGE SUMMARY:** Dounia insists that she must choose between her brother and her fiancé, Pyotr Petrovitch, to resolve their conflict.
